titleInfo.title: Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance study of ion-molecule reactions of [M - OCH 3] + ions of methyl 2,3,4,6-tetra-O-methyl-d-hexopyranosides with ammonia

mods.abstract: Glycosidic oxocarbenium ions A1+ were formed by isobutane chemical ionization from methyl 2,3,4,6-tetra-O-methyl-beta-D-mannopyranoside, methyl 2,3,4,6-tetra-O-methyl-beta-D-galactopyranoside and methyl 2,3,4,6-tetra-O-methyl-beta-D-glucopyranoside (the ring -O-being converted into -O+=), and their reaction with ammonia was studied by Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance spectrometry. Very slow formation (reaction efficiency 0.6-1.4%) of the adduct ion [A1 + NH3]+ was observed as the main process for carefully thermalized ions A1+. Interestingly, the efficiency of the adduct ion formation depends on the sterochemistry of ions A1+.

bibliographicCitation.dgps: Kovácik, V., Hirsch, J., Thölmann, D. & Grützmacher, H.-F. (1991). Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance study of ion-molecule reactions of [M - OCH 3] + ions of methyl 2,3,4,6-tetra-O-methyl-d-hexopyranosides with ammonia. Organic Mass Spectrometry, 26(12), 1085-1088. Wiley. doi:10.1002/oms.1210261210.
